sections.text: Interpreter; oath required.In any proceeding in which a deaf or hard of hearing person is testifying under oath or affirmation, the interpreter shall take an oath or affirmation that he or she will make a true interpretation of the proceeding in an understandable manner to the best of his or her ability.SourceLaws 1987, LB 376, ยง 8;R.S.1943, (1991), ยง 20-157;Laws 1997, LB 851, ยง 7.
